New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his career-high 47th homer.
Shohei Ohtani is continuing his march toward baseball's first 50-50 season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sparked a four-homer first inning with a 118.1-mph laser into the right-center-field seats.
Tommy Edman hit a two-run homer in the first inning and another two-run shot in the eighth.
Ohtani walked and stole his 48th base in the second inning.
Ohtani hit a two-out, two-run single in the third inning.
The Dodgers hit back-to-back-to-back homers in the first inning.
Gavin Lux lined a clutch, two-out RBI single to center in the seventh inning.
Tommy Edman hit his second homer of the game in the eighth inning.
Michael Kopech survived a harrowing ninth inning to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts commented on Bobby Miller's struggles and the team's resilience.
Will Smith expressed the team's awareness and excitement about Ohtani's 50-50 quest.
Dave Roberts discussed the MVP debate between Shohei Ohtani and Francisco Lindor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers avoided a three-game sweep and pushed their National League West lead to five games over Arizona.
The Dodgers reduced their magic number to clinch the division title to 12 with 16 games to play.
